titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Jackie Goldberg papers 1993-1995 LSC.2196

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.date: Online finding aid last updated 29 November 2017.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-29T11:55-0800

did.abstract: Jackie Goldberg is an openly lesbian politician, teacher, and former member of the California State Assembly. This collection represents Jackie Goldberg's campaign for City Council in Los Angeles in 1993. Included are campaign materials as well as news coverage of the campaign and Goldberg herself.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jackie Goldberg Papers, (Collection 2196). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Stacy Wood, 2013. Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Sabrina Ponce in 2017.

odd.head: Sponsor
odd.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: A graduate of Morningside High School in Inglewood, California, Jackie Goldberg went on to graduate from the University of California, Berkeley, where she was a member of the campus political party SLATE and a major player in the Free Speech Movement while on campus. She also holds a master's degree in education from the University of Chicago.

Goldberg was elected to the State Assembly in November 2000, representing the state's 45th district. Sworn in in December 2000, she had previously served as a member of the Los Angeles City Council. Before being elected to the council, she served on and was later president of the Los Angeles School Board and before that, she had been a teacher in the Compton Unified School District.

She was re-elected in 2002 and 2004. Jackie Goldberg is openly lesbian and was a founder member of the California Legislative LGBT Caucus. She married her longtime partner, Susan Stricker in 2008. She is also a founding member of the Progressive Caucus in Sacramento. Jackie and her wife have one son.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection represents Jackie Goldberg's campaign for City Council in Los Angeles in 1993. Included are campaign materials as well as news coverage of the campaign and Goldberg herself.

controlaccess.corpname: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA.
controlaccess.subject: Women politicians--California--Los Angeles--Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Photos from the campaign for City Council of Los Angeles in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Mailers, flyers and informational packets related to the campaign for City Council in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: News stories in major and minor news outlets in Los Angeles covering the City Council race of 1993. Some specifically profile Goldberg, while others are about the race in general.
